    • Method Detail

      • identifyClockSource

        public static Pin identifyClockSource(Pin netSource)
        Tries to identify the clock pin source for the given user signal output by tracing back to a FF within a SLICE. TODO - This method is not very robust.
        Parameters:
        netSource - The site pin output from which to start the clock search
        Returns:
        The source clock pin for the clock net or null if unable to determine one.

      • getClockDomain

        public static Net getClockDomain(Design d,
                                 java.lang.String edifNet)

      • getDrivingCell

        public static Cell getDrivingCell(Pin netSource)
        Tries to determine the driving cell within the site from the output site pin.
        Parameters:
        netSource - The output site pin from which to start searching
        Returns:
        The corresponding driving cell, or null if none could be found.

      • getDrivingElementPin

        public static ElementPin getDrivingElementPin(Pin netSource)
        Gets the originating driving element pin that corresponds to the given site pin.
        Parameters:
        netSource - The source pin
        Returns:
        The corresponding element pin or null if none could be found.

      • getDrivingElementPin

        public static ElementPin getDrivingElementPin(ElementPin elementPin)
        Gets the driving element pin of either a site port output or an element input pin.
        Parameters:
        elementPin - The element pin of interest. Cannot be a element output pin.
        Returns:
        The source element pin within the site for the given element pin.

      • getDrivenElementPins

        public static java.util.ArrayList<ElementPin> getDrivenElementPins(ElementPin elementPin)
        Gets the driven element pins of either a site port input or an element output pin.
        Parameters:
        elementPin - The element pin of interest. Cannot be an element input pin.
        Returns:
        A list of sink element pins within the site for the given element pin.

      • getCorrespondingRBELInputPin

        public static ElementPin getCorrespondingRBELInputPin(ElementPin outputPin,
                                                      SiteInstance inst)
        Uses SitePIP information in the site instance to determine the driving input of the RBEL element output pin. There should only be one input that can affect the output and this method returns that input pin.
        Parameters:
        outputPin - The output pin on the RBEL element of interest.
        inst - The corresponding site instance where the pin resides.
        Returns:
        The driving input element pin on the RBEL, or null if none could be found.

      • getCorrespondingRBELOutputPin

        public static ElementPin getCorrespondingRBELOutputPin(ElementPin inputPin,
                                                       SiteInstance inst)
        Returns the element's output pin corresponding that is being driven by the provided input pin.
        Parameters:
        inputPin - The input pin of interest
        inst - The site instance corresponding to the element of interest
        Returns:
        The element's output pin that is driven by the provided input pin.

      • createPinAndAddToNet

        public static Pin createPinAndAddToNet(Cell cell,
                                       java.lang.String cellPinName,
                                       Net net)
        Creates a new pin on a site connected to the cell pin and also adds it to the provided net. Updates both logical and physical netlist representations. Note: If the site pin being added is an output it will displace any existing output source on the given net.
        Parameters:
        cell - The placed source or sink BEL instance from which to trace to a site pin. Must have a direct connection to a site pin.
        cellPinName - Name of the logical pin name on the cell.
        net - The net to add the pin to.
        Returns:
        The newly created pin that has been added to net

      • calculateUtilization

        public static java.util.HashMap<UtilizationType,java.lang.Integer> calculateUtilization(Design d)

      • isCellLutMemory

        private static boolean isCellLutMemory(Cell c)

        private static void incrementUtilType(java.util.HashMap<UtilizationType,java.lang.Integer> map,
                                      UtilizationType ut)

      • placeCells

        public static boolean placeCells(Design d,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> desiredCellPlacements)
        Places a set of cells according to the map provided. Attempts to 'route' the touched sites after all placements are made (still WIP).
        Parameters:
        d - Design to be used
        desiredCellPlacements - Map of cell placements where the key is full hierarchical name of the cell and value is the full bel site name (ex: SLICE_X0Y0/AFF).
        Returns:
        True if all placements succeeded, false otherwise

      • createIBUF

        public static EDIFCellInstance createIBUF(Design design,
                                          java.lang.String portName,
                                          Site site,
                                          Net portNet,
                                          EDIFNet logNet,
                                          java.lang.String ioStandard)
        This method will create a generic IBUF instance (INBUF+IBUFCTRL) at the top level of a design.
        Parameters:
        design - The design to which the IBUF will be added
        portName - Name of the port at the top level
        site - IO site to place the IBUF
        portNet - Physical net of the port
        logNet - Logical net of the port
        ioStandard - IO standard to configure the IBUF
        Returns:
        The cell instance of the IBUF with INBUF and IBUFCTRL as children

      • createIBUFInstance

        private static EDIFCellInstance createIBUFInstance(java.lang.String type,
                                                   java.lang.String portName,
                                                   EDIFNetlist n)

      • createPadCell

        private static Cell createPadCell(Site site,
                                  SiteInstance inst,
                                  java.lang.String portName)

      • createOBUF

        public static Cell createOBUF(Design design,
                              java.lang.String portName,
                              Site site,
                              Net portNet,
                              EDIFNet logNet,
                              java.lang.String ioStandard)

      • createBUFGCE

        public static Cell createBUFGCE(Design d,
                                EDIFCell parent,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                Site location)
        Creates a new BUFGCE instance in the parent cell provided and places it at location. It will automatically connect the CE pin to VCC.
        Parameters:
        d - The current design
        parent - The parent cell (logical netlist EDIF) to which this BUFGCE instance belongs.
        name - Name of the BUGFGCE instance.
        location - The site on the device to place this BUFGCE.
        Returns:
        The newly created cell.

      • createIBUFDS

        public static EDIFCellInstance createIBUFDS(Design design,
                                            java.lang.String portNameP,
                                            java.lang.String portNameN,
                                            Site siteP,
                                            Site siteN,
                                            Net portNet,
                                            EDIFNet logNet,
                                            java.lang.String ioStandard)
        This method will create a generic IBUFDS instance (DIFFINBUF+IBUFCTRL) at the top level of a design.
        Parameters:
        design - The design to which the IBUFDS will be added
        portNameP - Positive Name of the port at the top level
        portNameN - Negative Name of the port at the top level
        siteP - Positive IO site to place the IBUFDS
        siteN - Negative IO site to place the IBUFDS
        portNet - Physical net of the port
        logNet - Logical net of the port
        ioStandard - IO standard to configure the IBUF
        Returns:
        The cell instance of the IBUF with INBUF and IBUFCTRL as children
